title: Add fade-in effect on looping background music

requirements.text: Update the background music player so the background audio fades in smoothly each time playback starts, including when the track restarts as part of looping.
acceptanceCriteria: When the background music begins playing (autoplay start or after pressing Play), its volume ramps up from near-silent to the intended listening volume over a short, smooth fade-in.
When the track reaches the end and restarts (loop), the restart is not abrupt; the audio fades in again on the new loop iteration.
The fade-in must not change the userâ€™s mute state: if the user is muted, the player remains muted and no audible sound is produced.
Play/Pause and Mute/Unmute controls continue to work as they do now, with no UI regressions.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components only).
Do not change the passcode gate behavior or any locked-screen minimal UI behavior as part of this change.
nonGoals: Adding fade-out behavior (only fade-in is required).
Changing which audio file is used (continue using the existing local /background.mp3 source).
Adding new pages, sections, or backend persistence for audio settings.
